titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Labor and Radicalism Photograph Collection PHOTOS.001
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Finding aid prepared by Tamiment Staff

editionstmt.p: This version was derived from NP 1 Guide General Photo Collection.doc

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-12-02T10:36-0500

change.item: Edited by Rachel Searcy for compliance with DACS and Tamiment Required Elements for Archival Description (May 2012); by Maggie Schreiner to reflect the incorporation of non-print materials; by Erika Gottfried to update location of materials; by Giana Ricci to reflect accession 2014.111; by Heather Mulliner in 2014 to include additional accession information; by Nicole Greenhouse in 2014 to include box numbers.

did.unittitle: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Labor and Radicalism Photograph Collection

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

physdesc.extent: in 12 manuscript boxes, 4 oversize flat boxes, 14 folders in three flat-file drawers.

did.abstract: The Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Labor and Radicalism Photograph Collection is an assemblage of photographs collected by or separated from manuscript collections or organizational records in the library's holdings. Materials include original photographs, reproductions from books, pamphlets, periodicals, and photoreproductions of engravings, drawings, and cartoons concerning radicalism and the trade union movement in Europe and the United States.

custodhist.head: Custodial History note
custodhist.p: Unlike other Tamiment/Wagner photograph collections, these images do not come from just one individual or organizational donor, but from myriad different sources, and have been merged to form an artificial collection. It was created (and is still being added to) to serve as a "home" for useful images that do not fit into the scope of Tamiment's regular archival collections. Other images are drawn from many different sources. These include photograph, book illustrations, and other published materials that have been separated from Tamiment/Wagner papers and manuscript collections because they are not related to the specific subjects of the collections, but are nonetheless relevant to Tamiment/Wagner subject areas.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Because of the assembled nature of this collection, copyright status varies across the collection. Copyright is assumed to be held by the original creator of individual items in the collection; these items are expected to pass into the public domain 120 years after their creation. The Tamiment Library is not authorized to grant permission to publish or reproduce materials from this collection.

accruals.head: Accurals Note
accruals.p: Images continue to be added to the collection from various sources, including the Library's archival and manuscript collections.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This is an expanding artificial collection originally known as the Tamiment Library / Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives General Photograph Collection. Apart from the material transferred to the Library’s vertical files, the collection holds photographic images that complement, but are not part of or do not fit into the scope of the Library’s other holdings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The materials in this collection include original photographs, reproductions from books, pamphlets, periodicals, and photoreproductions of engravings, drawings, and cartoons concerning radicalism and the trade union movement in Europe and the United States. The vast majority of the images are portraits of individuals including Eugene Debs, Morris Hillquit, Rose Schneiderman, Karl Kautsky, Algernon Lee, James Hudson Maurer, Rose Pastor Stokes and Norman Thomas. The remainder of the collection includes a wide (if sometimes idiosyncratic) variety of images, including strikes, demonstrations, Socialist Party, and other radical left organizations' events and celebrations, workers' summer resorts, women and minority workers, and sweatshops.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: This collection was created by Tamiment Library through several donations over the years. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 1950.197, 2011.068, and 2014.062. A donation of one panoramic photograph was donated by Jessica Smith via Henry Foner in 1997. The accession number associated with this item is 2013.021. Additionally photographs of the Wagner family were found in repository in April of 2014 and were added to this collection. The accession number associated with this material is 2014.111. Rand School of Social Science materials were donated in 1963. The accession numbers associated with this collection are 1963.014, NPA.2005.011, and NPA.2005.006.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically by subject in the finding aid; within the collection they are arranged numerically.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements Note
phystech.p: Due to the fragile nature of the original materials, researchers must use photocopies of the Triangle Fire photographs (Folder 487).

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: The Rand School of Social Science Photograph Collection (PHOTOS 196) was incorporated into the Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Labor and Radicalism Photograph Collection in 2014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives Radicalism Photograph Collection; PHOTOS 001; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
